text: 98% of drivers in Sindh lack understanding of traffic rules and safety, leading to increased accidents. Motorcyclists and pedestrians constitute the majority of victims.
Over 43,000 motorbikes seized for helmet violations as crackdown continues across the city. Authorities also impounded vehicles with fancy number plates and tinted windows.
Three killed as a speeding dumper collides with a car on the Main Northern Bypass. The driver was arrested after fleeing the scene.
Seven dead and several injured in multiple traffic accidents across Karachi, including a bus overturning in Gulshan-i-Hadeed.
Goods transporters' rally against roadblocks across Sindh causes severe traffic congestion in Karachi's business district.
Fact-finding body formed to probe rising traffic accidents in Karachi, investigating over 600 fatalities since November.
Plan to empower Karachi wardens to impose fines for wrong-way driving. A resolution will be presented in the City Council for approval.
Gridlock in city centre as police close key roads to stop protests by the Baloch Yakjehti Committee, causing massive traffic jams.
Eight family members killed as their car plunges into a ravine in Lower Kohistan while returning from Gilgit Baltistan.
Motorways to soon have air ambulance services to address high mortality rates resulting from road accidents.
Traffic flow remains smooth on Shahrah-e-Faisal and adjacent roads in Gulshan-e-Iqbal. No major disruptions reported.
Minor congestion observed in Korangi and Malir during peak hours. Traffic police advise commuters to plan accordingly.
